On Fri, 6 Sep 2002, dph_of_rules wrote:

> My initial test of integrating all components shown in the GUI works
> great except for one thing: I can't quite read from the grid file the
> max x value and max y value.  I was looking through your code in
> pixedit.c to find that information, but I can't seem to follow it.
> What byte number in the grid file is that information located and what
> type of variable (integer or byte) is that information stored in?

For just looking for format, Sean's pixieread util is probably easier to
follow. But here's the format anyways:

1 byte for number of frames (in the case of map files, that should always
be 1)
1 byte for x size of frames
1 byte for y size of frames
Then numframes * x * y bytes of actual graphics data (a bunch of palette
indexes since it uses 8-bit color).


That should do it. If not, I made a type writing this message :-)

- Zardus
